item.title: 2023年8月に窃盗、倫理観の欠如、セクハラで告発されたライナス・テック・ティップス社は、外部調査の結果、主張は「ほとんど根拠がない」と発表した（Jeremy Gan/Dexerto）
item.description:

Linus Tech Tips, accused in August 2023 of theft, ethical lapses, and sexual harassment, says an outside investigation found the claims were “largely unfounded”  —  Linus Tech Tips has released the findings from an investigation of the allegations levied upon them in 2023 …

item.title: 情報源: 時計愛好家向けウェブサイトHodinkeeの収益が、時計市場の暴落に伴う管理不行き届きの非難を受け、2021年の～1億ドルから2023年には～7000万ドルに減少した（Jacob Gallagher/Wall Street Journal）。
item.description:
Jacob Gallagher / Wall Street Journal:
Sources: revenue for watch enthusiast website Hodinkee fell to ~$70M in 2023 from ~$100M in 2021, amid accusations of mismanagement as the watch market crashed  —  The website Hodinkee reinvented watch culture, giving luxury timepieces the same air as a pair of rare Nikes.

item.title: ボストンを拠点とする公共メディアGBHは、従業員の4％にあたる31人のレイオフを発表。
item.description:
Liz Neisloss / GBH:
Boston-based public media outlet GBH announced layoffs of 31 staff members, or 4% of its workforce, with roughly 10% of its news staff among those laid off  —  GBH announced layoffs of 31 staff members on Wednesday, representing 4% of its overall workforce.

item.description:

Sources: News Corp's Rebekah Brooks and Robert Thomson joined Lachlan Murdoch in Sydney for meetings ahead of a major restructuring announcement next week  —  Staff brace for significant cuts as media giant prepares to make moves to counter decline of print and slow advertising market

item.title: 情報源サンダンス、2027年の映画祭移転に向け15カ所からの提案を検討中、9月末頃に内部で決定予定（Dominic Patten/Deadline）
item.description:
Dominic Patten / Deadline:
Sources: Sundance is weighing proposals from 15 locations to move the festival in 2027; a decision is expected internally around the end of September  —  EXCLUSIVE: The Sundance Film Festival is looking South for a potential new home, as well as in its backyard.

item.title: ビッグ・ルー・メディアは、セントルイスのオルト週刊誌「リバーフロント・タイムズ」を非公開の買い手に売却し、執筆・編集スタッフ全員を解雇した（STLPR）。
item.description:
STLPR:
Big Lou Media has sold The Riverfront Times, an alt weekly in St. Louis, Mo, to an undisclosed buyer, and the entire writing and editing staff has been laid off  —  The Riverfront Times, St. Louis' alt-weekly newspaper, is no more, at least in its current state.

item.title: TV視聴者の高齢化に伴い、メディア幹部はTVのマス・マーケットへのリーチを重視し、広告主にとっての年齢の重要性を軽視している（ウォール・ストリート・ジャーナル紙）。
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
As TV audiences get older, media executives are focusing more on the mass-market reach of TV, and playing down the importance of age for advertisers  —  With viewers in their 60s, networks aren't pretending to have youth appeal; they're touting the virtues of older audiences

item.title: Rolling Stone社は、サウジアラビアの国営投資ファンドPIFが所有するESL FACEIT Groupと提携し、ゲームバーティカル「RS Gaming」を立ち上げる（Chris Kerr/Game Developer）

Chris Kerr / Game Developer:
Rolling Stone launches RS Gaming, a game vertical in partnership with ESL FACEIT Group, which is owned by Saudi state-backed investment fund PIF  —  Rolling Stone is expanding its coverage of the video game industry with the launch of a dedicated gaming vertical.
